column3: str
This well-meaning mother has spread herself a little too thin.
Express /doubt as to what the children have been up to.
Speak with the well-meaning mother.
I swear, where did those boys run off to this time?
Excuse me, <If(PlayerParameter(4))>miss<Else/>sir</If>. I've searched everywhere and I can't find my boys. Would you help me look for them?
Work has kept me so busy I haven't been able to spend any time with them. Even when I do have a few moments to spare, they're always gone doing gods know what.

If you find them and they start making excuses, you'd be wise to <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>doubt<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> them. Still, they've never been the sort to get into trouble. <sigh> I hope they're okay.

They're sure to make up excuses to avoid getting in trouble, but I know my boys. If you show any <UIForeground>F201F4</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201F5</UIGlow>doubt<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground> of their stories, they'll tell the truth.
Wh-What? Mother sent you to check on me? I haven't done anything bad, I promise.
I've been studying the plants and bugs out here. Someday I'm going to be a scholar, and make lots of money so Mother doesn't have to work so hard all the time.
I never meant to make her worry. I better go home and let her know I'm okay.
...I've never seen wings like this on a bug before. I wonder why they're so different?
Mother sent you? She's always making a fuss over nothing.
I was just training is all. I'm going to join the Resistance, and defeat all the Garleans. Then she won't have to worry about anything ever again.
I wanted to practice a bit more before I told her, but I don't want her getting worked up over nothing. I should be heading back before she gets mad.
What do you want? Can't you see I'm busy practicing?
The boys are home, safe and sound. I don't know what you told them, but they certainly had a lot on their minds when they walked through the door.
They grow up so fast... I usually only ever see them when they're sleeping, but I looked into their eyes today and saw a fire that wasn't there before.
They've never known their father, but no matter how bad things got, I did everything I could to give them a happy childhood.
We'll be alright, you wait and see. I may look battered and beaten, but we mothers are made of sterner stuff. Our love for our children is the greatest strength there is.
